items.title: Basketball, The Natural Prediction
items.text: For this project, me and my team thought ”if even nature uses natural selection to evolve things, why shouldn't we?” So we built a natural selection system in python from scratch, without any AI libraries, to help us predict the result of games using data from past games.

items.title: WikiSpeed, The daily game of links
items.text: In this game you start in a Wikipedia page and you have to get to another specified page just using the links. You can play this game by clicking here

items.title: Netflix, the return of the clone
items.text: For this project, I wanted to pratice my CSS, so I choose a site with a style known by most people and tried to copy its design.

items.title: Cubik, minimalistic rubiks cube timer
items.text: Most of online timers are full of stuff and have a heavy design, the idea here was just to create a clean one.

items.title: Joelho-e-o-Pe-de-Feijao, The game
items.text: This is a 2D platform game made with C# on Unity. It was developed with a friend as a school project. The idea was to make a simple game but with a focus in character movement and other controls feeling good to play

items.title: GregFolio. Yes, this Website
items.text: it's a simple site, but it was fun to make. Made in ReactJs using styled-components.

items.title: Lince, The growing local company
items.text: Lince was responsible for making the tecnology for the two biggest factories of my city. There I used a mix of Java, Javascript, and CSS inside another language called Xseed, a COBOL to Java migration language. I stayed 6 months there, and left to focus in React.

items.title: SCI - Sistemas contábeis
items.text: SCI is a company that makes accounting systems for people and for other companies. I worked maintaining their system during 1 year. There I worked Delphi, which was not my favorite stack but it was a great experience.

items.title: Edition
items.text: Editing, both video and images, has been one of my hobbies for the last 8 years, and I learned a lot in this time. In the matter of technology, I have experience with Sony Vegas and DaVinci Resolve for videos, and Photoshop and Illustrator for images.

items.title: Maybe it's just that
items.text: I thought that I would have more to say. Sorry for creating a new session just for it.
